BodDou52.Transcription:
Speke frenssh & constreue art & þu schalt selde com to
                    thy part
BodDou52.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Die Mittelenglische Sprichwörtersammlung in Douce 52.” 
             Festschrift zum XII Deutschen Neuphilolgentage in München
                1906.
            E. Stollreither, ed. 
         Erlangen (1906): 40-64: 48.

RylandsLat394.Transcription:
Speke frensche & constrwe arteAnd þu shalt selde come to
                    þy parte
RylandsLat394.Note:
Translating ‘Gallice sillabica logicalia construe dicta / Et
                        propriam partem partinges raro per artem’, which follows
                    it.
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 97.
